org.svvrl.goal.core.util
Class Relation<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.util.Relation<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements in this relation
public class Relation<T>
extends java.lang.Object

A Relation is a configurable relation. The relation can be reflexive or non-reflexive, symmetric or non-symmetric, and transitive or non-transitive.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

addRelation

Parameters:
o - an element
os - a set of elements

removeRelation

public boolean removeRelation(T o1,
                              T o2)
Removes the relation o1 × o2, and o2 × o1 if this relation is symmetric. Note that o1 and o2 may still be related if (1) this relation is transitive or (2) o1 and o2 are equal and this relation is reflexive.

Parameters:
o1 - an element
o2 - an element
Returns:
true if o1 × o2 was in this relation before this removal

removeRelation

public boolean removeRelation(T o,
                              java.util.Collection<T> os)
Removes the relation o × t for all elements t in a specified set. If this relation is symmetric, then t × o will also be removed.

Parameters:
o - an element
os - a set of elements
Returns:
true if there is at least one t in the set such that o × t was in this relation before this removal
See Also:
removeRelation(Object, Object)

hasRelation

public boolean hasRelation(T o1,
                           T o2)
Returns true if o1 × o2 is in this relation.

Parameters:
o1 - an element
o2 - an element
Returns:
true if o1 × o2 is in this relation

getRelated

public java.util.Set<T> getRelated(T o)
Returns the set {x | o × x is in this relation}. Modification of the returned set will not change the relation in this object.

Parameters:
o - an element
Returns:
the set {x | o × x is in this relation}

getRelation

public java.util.Map<T,java.util.Set<T>> getRelation()
Returns this relation as a map from an element to the set of related elements. Note that the returned map does not enforce reflexivity, symmetry or transitivity.

Returns:
this relation as a map from an element to the set of related elements

getEquivalenceClasses

public java.util.Set<java.util.Set<T>> getEquivalenceClasses()
Returns the equivalent classes. For any two elements o1 and o2 in an equivalent class, o1 × o2 is in this relation.

Returns:
the equivalent classes
